title: How to Make Chocolate Flapjacks

steps.headline: Melt the butter or margarine with the light brown sugar in a pan on the stove.
steps.description: A medium heat will be fine. Wait until it turns into a liquid. Check to make sure there are no lumps.

steps.headline: Add the porridge oats.
steps.description: The oats will start to turn a golden colour in with the sugar and the butter.

steps.headline: Wait for the mixture to thicken then add the golden syrup.
Put the flapjack mixtures into a Pyrex dish or a other suitable, oven proof dish.
steps.description: Level it out so your flapjacks are all the same thickness.

steps.headline: Place the dish full of mixture in the oven for 20 minutes on gas mark 200 or equivalent.
Take the hot dish out of oven when the flapjack has finished cooking.
steps.description: Be very careful, the dish and the flapjack will be very hot. Leave it out for about 10 minutes to cool.

steps.headline: Put water in a pan then put a bowl on top and heat the water and let the chocolate melt.
Pour the chocolate, once it has melted over the flapjack.
steps.description: Leave to set then slice into squares or rectangles as you prefer.

text: Melt the butter or margarine with the light brown sugar in a pan on the stove. A medium heat will be fine. Wait until it turns into a liquid. Check to make sure there are no lumps. Add the porridge oats. The oats will start to turn a golden colour in with the sugar and the butter. Wait for the mixture to thicken then add the golden syrup.  Put the flapjack mixtures into a Pyrex dish or a other suitable, oven proof dish. Level it out so your flapjacks are all the same thickness. Place the dish full of mixture in the oven for 20 minutes on gas mark 200 or equivalent.  Take the hot dish out of oven when the flapjack has finished cooking. Be very careful, the dish and the flapjack will be very hot. Leave it out for about 10 minutes to cool. Melt the chocolate.  Put water in a pan then put a bowl on top and heat the water and let the chocolate melt.  Pour the chocolate, once it has melted over the flapjack. Leave to set then slice into squares or rectangles as you prefer.
